com.gnahraf.io.store.karoon.merge

Class TableRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gnahraf.io.store.karoon.merge.TableRegistry

  • public class TableRegistry
extends Object
    Used to mediate access to tables. This mediation achieves 2 things:
    1. Disallows the same table being the source of multiple concurrent merge operations.
    2. Tracks table usage and notifies when a table may be safely deleted.
    Author:
    Babak

    • Method Detail

      • advanceCommit

        public boolean advanceCommit(CommitRecord commit)
        Attempts to advance the "last-seen-commit" to the specified commit record. This method succeeds if the given commit's ID is ≥ the last-seen-commit (that is, at or more recent).
        Parameters:
        commit -
        Returns:
        true if the given commit is at or later than the last seen commit (i.e. if commit.getId() >= latestCommit.getId()

      • checkOut

        public Releaseable checkOut(List<Long> sourceTableIds,
                   List<Long> backSetTableIds,
                   CommitRecord commit)
        Attempts to check out the given tables for a merge. On success a Releaseable object is returned; if the check out fails, null is returned.

        A source table (identified by its ID) may only ever be checked out by a single (unclosed) Releaseable instance. There's no such restriction on the backset tables used by the merge.

        The sourceTableIds and backSetTableIds are assumed to come from the commit record (CommitRecord.getTableIds(). This requirement is not enforced, but failure to observe it will break the reference counting--as well as possibly other undefined behavior.

        Parameters:
        sourceTableIds - the IDs of the source tables. The caller agrees not to modify the list.
        backSetTableIds - the IDS of the tables in the backset. The caller agrees not to modify the list.
        commit - the commit snapshot at which this check out occurs. (advanceCommit is first invoked in the same atomic operation.)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null

      • checkOutImpl

        public boolean checkOutImpl(List<Long> sourceTableIds,
                   List<Long> backSetTableIds,
                   CommitRecord commit)
